intro: Erucago brachyptera, commonly known as the narrow-winged erucoid, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are simple and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
